reviewText: I noticed there had been three individual sets of drive in classics recently, then I noticed some of the same artwork on this 32 movie set pretty much covering the other three sets, and better yet I got it at half price sale one day.  Oh sure, such movies that I believe were on the number two of the individual sets, like "They Saved Hitlers' Brain", wasn't interested in having a third or fourth copy of that anyway.  Transfers seems pretty good for most of them, I haven't watched all of them, they probably were movies that could have been shown at drive ins back in the day.  12 disc set on double sided discs in black paper sleeves, and no playability problems, etc.Come to find out, there was a company called bci, which has been going out of business and splitting up with a partner company, mill creek bought alot of their archive, and they once put these out, and there are some more that bci had put out that is no longer in print, but mill creek will likely or already has released them, great, I will be watching.I also recommend "Savage Cinema" by mill creek, worth watching those, and "Cult Terror Cinema" from mill creek, along with "20 Cult Classics" that included all the great oldie movies like reefer madness/cocaine fiends/ she should have said no!, etc, ha, those are real cheap and good entertainment as well and less than ten bucks.
summary: Great set, interesting movies, amazon/mill creek comes through again

reviewText: These movies are just what they claim to be - nothing more. They will remind you that being at the drive-in was more fun than watching the movie. Still, the movies provide a fun reminder of those days, especially since I'm watching them again with the same girl.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Back in 2010, I was at one of my haunts to find movies at bargin prices.  I found a Mill Creek 50 Movie Pack.  I loved it & started to aquire more from Mill Creek Entertainment since then.  This is one of the better ones that I have bought from them.When I saw this for nly $9.99 at a store and bought it.  I started watching the movies & wound up enjoying the entire campyness of the old B through Z rate Drive-In Movies.  And most, if not all, of these movies are from the Old Crown International Studios catalog.  And One should enjoy these campy movies for what they are, SHEER ENJOYMENT of an age now long gone!!!  It is sad that one will never get the same effect from modern B-Rate Movies that are made for a certain Cable and/or Satilite company channel.I really do like the bulk of these movies (especially Van Nuys BLVD).  And while the film quality of the transfers aren't the best, that is part of their charm.  So if you like cheesy B-Rate Films, here they are in all their splended glory
summary: Mill Creek/Drive in Cult Classics Great Price Great Movie Set

reviewerName: Jason P. Pumphrey "the movie & music man"
reviewText: Well, there are actually 31 films inlcuded in this package from Mill Creek, each of the 12 discs are double sided.One film is presented twice (The Pick Up), and two films that are said to be included in the collection  are not (those are the films Carnival Of Crime and Lurkers), this adds the extra copy of The Pick Up and includes The French Quarter instead.Still, even with the mistake, it's quite the bargain, since these films are quite obscure.Many of them are Crown International Pictures.This IS what included in the collection:Drive-In Cult Classics - 8 Movie SetDrive-In Cult Classics, Vol. 2Drive-In Cult Classics: Volume ThreeAfter Dark ThrillersPS, Carvival Of Crime and Lurkers are found on this collection:Cult Terror Cinema (12 Movie Collection)which is also a great collection from Mill Cfreek.
summary: 31 Drive In Cult Classics actually, read on...

reviewText: A collection of low, low, low budget movies featuring actors either getting their starts or nearing the ends of their careers. If you're a fan of Mystery Science Theater 3000 you may have seen some of these already. This collection features the best (or worst) of exploitation films. Almost all of these movies are collected in separate DVD sets. Note that the box lists Lurkers and Carnival of Crime but these movies were not in the set I received (see below). Not sure if this is a one time thing.Disc 1-The Teacher-Pick-up-Best Friends-Trip With TeacherDisc 2-Stepmother-Sister In Law-Malibu High-Cindy and DonnaDisc 3-They Saved Hitler's Brain (Aka Madmen of Mandora with added scenes)-Madmen of MandoraDisc 4-Bloodlust-The Devil's HandDisc 5-The Creeping Terror-TerrifiedDisc 6-Land of The Minotaur (Stars Peter Cushing and Donald Pleasence)-The Hearse (featuring Joseph Cotten)Disc 7-The Babysitter-Weekend with the Babysitter (basically a remake of the Babysitter featuring the same male lead actor!)Disc 8-Pink Angels-Blood ManiaDisc 9-Single Room Furnished-Van Nuys Blvd.Disc 10-Pom Pom Girls-Malibu BeachDisc 11-Blue Money (incorrectly titled on the box as Blue Monday)-Double Exposure-Separate Ways (Starring Karen Black)-Night ClubDisc 12 (This disc is incorrectly titled, one side is labeled as Lurkers/Carnival of Crime but instead has Pick Up/French Quarter)-Click: The Calendar Girl Killer-Hot Target-Pick Up-French Quarter
summary: Drive in cinema at its best (or worst)

reviewText: UPDATE: I give this set a 3 out of 5 for such a shoddy way they packaged it. "Pick Up" is on TWO discs here, really crappy way to sell a product. The content is good and it's not the end of the world, and yes "Pick Up" is the same movie not two different versions.The set I got DID have "French Quarter" in it, along with "Pick Up" on one side and "Click" and "Hot Target" on the other side of disc 12 (not listed on the box itself). It was missing Carnival of Crime and Lurkers which is listed on the box. Weird. Since I didn't order it for either of those movies and the ones it came with are newer and have sex in them I'm not complaining. FYI if you are ordering for any of those titles.The set looks like they took prior box sets and just packaged them together because they have different menu's or none at all. Also a few of these have a drive in experience menu with a couple of cartoons (I saw one Woody Woodpecker and one Popeye cartoon), along with the same drive in snack ad's for each disc with those extras.I'm happy I ordered it but if I have criticism it's the titles not listed properly on the box, and that the sleeves they come in are not labeled so I had to spend an hour going through each disc and labeling the sleeves with masking tape and a pen. The discs are labeled but you have to have better then 20/20 eyesight to read the ultra small font they used, I can hardly read it with my glasses on. In recap these are the films I got in case you are ordering this for a particular film: disc 1 "Best Friends/ Trip With The Teacher" & "Pick Up/ The Teacher" disc 2 "Sister In Law/ The Stepmother" & "Malibu High/ Cindy and Donna" disc 3 "They Saved Hitler's Brain & Madmen Of Mandoras" Disc 4 "The Devil's Hand (with Woody Woodpecker "Pantry Panic" cartoon)" & Bloodlust" disc 5 "The Creeping Terror" & "Terrified" disc 6 "Land Of The Minotaur" & "The Hearse" disc 7 "The Babysitter" & "Weekend With The Babysitter" disc 8 "Blood Mania" & "Pink Angels" disc 9 "Single Room Furnished" & "Van Nuys Blvd (with Popeye cartoon "Taxi -Turvy")" disc 10 "Pom Pom Girls (with drive in ad's as an extra)" & "Malibu Beach" disc 11 "Blue Money/ Double Exposure" & "Seperate Ways/ Night Club" disc 12 "Click/ Hot Target" & "Pick Up/ French Quarter"Although I got these films there is no guarantee you will get the same so be prepared for surprises. Finally I did order this as a new set from Amazon not a used set so there is no chance the discs got mixed up that way. Could I return it to Amazon, of course but French Quarter looks like a good flick so it's OK not to get Carnival of Crime and Lurkers. But it doesn't deserve a 5 star when you don't get the films it's advertized as.
summary: Comes With Titles Missing and Others Not Listed
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have a front projection setup and watch movies on a 110" screen (120" for 3D Blu-rays). Though not the best quality prints, it's great to just throw one of these DVDs in the player and feel like I'm a kid again at the drive-in!The DVDs are 2-sided and are in paper sleeves stacked atop eachother in a compact box. Not the nicest packaging, but it would take up so much more room on my movie shelf if a more elaborate package were used. Many of these titles have never been released for home video!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This set was on sale for very little money, so I bought them.  Amazon prime shipped and delivered a few days later.  Dropped the first DVD into a player and started watching.  About 45 minutes into the movie, the player made a little noise and ejected the DVD.Flipped it over.  Same.Tried it in 3 other DVD players/computers here. disk-read errors.  Ok, 1 bad disk out of 12 ... fine ...Except it wasn't just 1 bad disk.  At least 5 discs of the 12 are flawed.  With some, I can see the physical bubbles on the discs.  Ok, perhaps this was a bad set?Asked Amazon to replace the set - I'll return the old set.The new set arrived yesterday, so I let them acclimate to the inside temperature overnight and decided to try and read all of them today.  So far, 2 of the discs have flaws that cannot be read over and 1 of them is taking over an hour to "read" - a good disc takes about 7 minutes.Finished reading all the disks in the 2nd set - only 2 had issues - 3 sides total.2 less than perfect sets?  Not good. Seems the same disks are showing problems (disk 8).Amazon's price for the set has more than doubled and emails reminding me to return the first set have been clear about the new price.  Supply/demand.2 Stars because of all the disc failures.
summary: WARNING - Bad Discs from 2 different deliveries
Title: N/A
